question:
You recently took a plane to a holiday in a foreign city, and on arrival you found that your luggage was lost. You did not receive your luggage until the last day of your holiday. 




Write to the airline, 




complaining about this situation
saying why it caused you problems
seeking suitable compensation
text: My name is Rose Tam, and the policy number for my travel insurance is 091864. Here is the accident I had on the way to the airport in Vancouver.
From March 25 through March 31, 2022, Air Canada will be flying me. It leaves at 9:00 a.m.

My luggage disappeared shortly after landing. The baggage conveyor is on line B10. When I was waiting for my luggage, the conveyor failed to export it; I was already aware that it had been lost. As soon as I ask the Air Canada airline ground employees, they note the size and colour of my luggage. One bag with a black exterior, the "Elle" logo, no zip, and a Mickey Mouse sticker on the outside. The size is 27 inches.
Therefore, I will now file a claim for this accident with my travel insurance. I have uploaded a previous snapshot of my luggage. Please advise me of the necessary information and/or form(s).
